verses.verse: It is not expedient<WG4851> for me doubtless<WG1211> to glory.<WG2744> I will come<WG2064> to visions<WG3701> and revelations<WG602> of the Lord.<WG2962>

I knew<WG1492> a man<WG444> in Christ<WG5547> above<WG4253> fourteen<WG1180> years<WG2094> ago,<WG4253> (whether<WG1535> in the body,<WG4983> I cannot<WG3756> <WG1492> tell;<WG1492> or<WG1535> whether<WG1535> out of the body,<WG4983> I cannot<WG3756> <WG1492> tell:<WG1492> God<WG2316> knows;<WG1492>) such<WG5108> an one caught<WG726> up to the third<WG5154> heaven.<WG3772>
And I knew<WG1492> such<WG5108> a man,<WG444> (whether<WG1535> in the body,<WG4983> or<WG1535> out of the body,<WG4983> I cannot<WG3756> <WG1492> tell:<WG1492> God<WG2316> knows;<WG1492>)
How that he was caught<WG726> up into<WG1519> paradise,<WG3857> and heard<WG191> unspeakable<WG731> words,<WG4487> which<WG3739> it is not lawful<WG1832> for a man<WG444> to utter.<WG2980>
Of such<WG5108> an one will I glory:<WG2744> yet<WG1161> of myself<WG1683> I will not glory,<WG2744> but in my<WG3450> infirmities.<WG769>

For though<WG1437> I would desire<WG2309> to glory,<WG2744> I shall not be a fool;<WG878> for I will say<WG2046> the truth:<WG225> but now I forbear,<WG5339> lest<WG3361> any<WG5100> man should think<WG3049> of me above<WG5228> that which<WG3739> he sees<WG991> me to be, or<WG2228> that he hears<WG191> of me.

And lest<WG2443> <WG3361> I should be exalted<WG5229> above measure through the abundance<WG5236> of the revelations,<WG602> there was given<WG1325> to me a thorn<WG4647> in the flesh,<WG4561> the messenger<WG32> of Satan<WG4567> to buffet<WG2852> me, lest<WG2443> <WG3361> I should be exalted<WG5229> above measure.
For this<WG5127> thing I sought<WG3870> the Lord<WG2962> thrice,<WG5151> that it might depart<WG868> from me.

And he said<WG2046> to me, My grace<WG5485> is sufficient<WG714> for you: for my strength<WG1411> is made<WG5048> perfect<WG5048> in weakness. <WG769> Most<WG2236> gladly<WG2236> therefore<WG3767> will I rather<WG3123> glory<WG2744> in my infirmities,<WG769> that the power<WG1411> of Christ<WG5547> may rest<WG1981> on me.

Therefore<WG1352> I take pleasure<WG2106> in infirmities,<WG769> in reproaches,<WG5196> in necessities,<WG318> in persecutions,<WG1375> in distresses<WG4730> for Christ's<WG5547> sake: for when<WG3752> I am<WG1510> weak,<WG770> then<WG5119> am<WG1510> I strong.<WG1415>

I am become<WG1096> a fool<WG878> in glorying;<WG2744> you have compelled<WG315> me: for I ought<WG3784> to have been commended<WG4921> of you: for in nothing<WG3762> am I behind<WG5302> the very<WG3029> most chief<WG5228> <WG3029> apostles,<WG652> though<WG1499> I be nothing.<WG3762>
Truly<WG3303> the signs<WG4592> of an apostle<WG652> were worked<WG2716> among<WG1722> you in all<WG3956> patience,<WG5281> in signs,<WG4592> and wonders,<WG5059> and mighty<WG1411> deeds.<WG1411>

For what<WG5101> is it wherein<WG3757> you were inferior<WG2274> to other<WG3062> churches,<WG1577> except<WG1508> it be that I myself was not burdensome<WG2655> to you? forgive<WG5483> me this<WG5026> wrong.<WG93>

Behold,<WG2400> the third<WG5154> time I am ready<WG2093> to come<WG2064> to you; and I will not be burdensome<WG2655> to you: for I seek<WG2212> not your's <WG5216>but you: for the children<WG5043> ought<WG3784> not to lay<WG2343> up for the parents,<WG1118> but the parents<WG1118> for the children.<WG5043>
And I will very<WG2236> gladly<WG2236> spend<WG1159> and be spent<WG1550> for you; though<WG1499> the more<WG4056> abundantly<WG4056> I love<WG25> you, the less<WG2276> I be loved.<WG25>
But be it so, I did not burden<WG2599> you: nevertheless,<WG235> being<WG5225> crafty,<WG3835> I caught<WG2983> you with guile.<WG1388>
Did I make<WG4122> a gain<WG4122> of you by any<WG5100> of them whom<WG3739> I sent<WG649> to you?

I desired<WG3870> Titus,<WG5103> and with him I sent<WG4882> a brother.<WG80> Did Titus<WG5103> make<WG4122> a gain<WG4122> of you? walked<WG4043> we not in the same<WG846> spirit?<WG4151> walked<WG4043> we not in the same<WG846> steps?<WG2487>

Again,<WG3825> think<WG1380> you that we excuse<WG626> ourselves to you? we speak<WG2980> before<WG2714> God<WG2316> in Christ:<WG5547> but we do all<WG3956> things, dearly beloved,<WG27> for your<WG5216> edifying.<WG3619>

For I fear,<WG5399> lest,<WG3381> when I come,<WG2064> I shall not find<WG2147> you such<WG3634> as I would,<WG2309> and that I shall be found<WG2147> to you such<WG3634> as you would<WG2309> not: lest<WG3381> there be debates,<WG2054> contentions,<WG2205> wraths,<WG2372> strifes,<WG2052> backbitings,<WG2636> whisperings,<WG5587> arrogance,<WG5450> tumults:<WG181>

And lest,<WG3361> when I come<WG2064> again,<WG3825> my God<WG2316> will humble<WG5013> me among<WG4314> you, and that I shall mourn<WG3996> many<WG4183> which<WG3588> have sinned<WG4258> already,<WG4258> and have not repented<WG3340> of the uncleanness<WG167> and fornication<WG4202> and lasciviousness<WG766> which<WG3739> they have committed.<WG4238>
